text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires explaining that the Northern Ireland Protocol established that NI was effectively part of both the UK and EU customs territories, functioning as a 'customs valve'. The candidate answer clearly explains this dual status under the Windsor Framework (which amends the Protocol), stating NI has access to both the 'UK internal market' and the 'EU single market for goods'. It details the Green Lane/Red Lane system, which is the mechanism that creates this dual status, effectively making NI a customs valve between the two markets. The answer also correctly identifies the primary documents and their adoption context.", "criterion_id": "821ddcea-7e1d-45b8-8fba-32e37ae23575"}
